moves.1. e4 d6:
Pirc Attack!
 
 
As noted it's actually a defence that focueses around the four black moves: d6 Nf6 g6 and usually Bg7, and on White's side d4 e4 (or in a different order) Nc3. White has a lot of options and kind of controls what will be the style of the game with the following moves (e.g. 4 f4, 4Nf3 4Be3 or 4 g3).

I'm trying to get into this with the book Pirc Alert by Albert and Chernin :)
moves.2. d4: Natural reaction from White, occupying the centre
moves.2... Nf6: develops, attacks e4, most common move here in the Pirc I guess
moves.3... g6: preparing to give the dark-squared bishop a home on the long diagonal
moves.4... Bg7 5. Qe2:
overdefending e4, developing the queen

As noted by Chesscentral there would have been the possibility of:
4 ... Sxe4 5 Sxe4 d4 :) thx for the comment
moves.5... O-O: maybe developing to Nc6 was attractive here, which also guards the critical point e5?
moves.6... Bg4: pins the knight, attractive for a later Nc6xe4 threat
moves.7. e5: cracking up the centre, preparing a deadly king attack ;-)
moves.7... dxe5 8. dxe5: up to this point the game is equal I guess, however the knight needs to find a new home...
moves.8... Ne8:
? a bad decision, as the knight has no future here (only c7 which is not free yet). It would have been happier on h5, even it's on the dim.


Comment: My fear was that after Nd7 e6 woud follow. Of course fxe6 would yield Bxe6 Bxe6 Qxe6+. I did not feel that comfortable with that thought... Kh8 would have to follow since white could do Ng5! well... :)
moves.9. h3: asks the bishop for a decision
moves.9... Bxf3: ! kills the defender of e5 and weakens White's king side.
moves.10. gxf3: ?! interesting idea, White seems to plan queens-side castling and have an open g-file now.
moves.10... Nc6: develops, attacks e5. However, the poor knight on e8 is definitely entombed now for a while...
moves.11... Kh8: ? for enabling f6, however it will soon be in a deadly bind...
moves.13... fxe5: ? gxh5 would have saved a bit longer I guess, however, after Qxh5 it's lost soon anyway
moves.14... exf4: only move was Nf6, defending h7, however the game was already lost anyway
